segments.en: Numbered Discourses 4
12. With Kesi
111. With Kesi

segments.pli: Atha kho kesi assadammasārathi yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho kesiṃ assadammasārathiṃ bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Kesi the horse trainer went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side. The Buddha said to him,
“Kesi, you’re known as a horse trainer.

segments.pli: Kathaṃ pana tvaṃ, kesi, assadammaṃ vinesī”ti?
segments.en: Just how do you guide a horse in training?”

segments.pli: “Ahaṃ kho, bhante, assadammaṃ saṇhenapi vinemi, pharusenapi vinemi, saṇhapharusenapi vinemī”ti.
segments.en: “Sir, I guide a horse in training sometimes gently, sometimes harshly, and sometimes both gently and harshly.”

segments.pli: “Sace te, kesi, assadammo saṇhena vinayaṃ na upeti, pharusena vinayaṃ na upeti, saṇhapharusena vinayaṃ na upeti, kinti naṃ karosī”ti?
segments.en: “Kesi, what do you do with a horse in training that doesn’t follow these forms of training?”

segments.pli: “Sace me, bhante, assadammo saṇhena vinayaṃ na upeti, pharusena vinayaṃ na upeti, saṇhapharusena vinayaṃ na upeti;

segments.en: “In that case, sir, I kill it.
Why is that?
So that I don’t disgrace my profession.
But sir, the Buddha is the supreme guide for those who wish to train.

segments.pli: Kathaṃ pana, bhante, bhagavā purisadammaṃ vinetī”ti?
segments.en: Just how do you guide a person in training?”

segments.pli: “Ahaṃ kho, kesi, purisadammaṃ saṇhenapi vinemi, pharusenapi vinemi, saṇhapharusenapi vinemi.
segments.en: “Kesi, I guide a person in training sometimes gently, sometimes harshly, and sometimes both gently and harshly.
The gentle way is this:

segments.pli: iti kāyasucaritaṃ iti kāyasucaritassa vipāko, iti vacīsucaritaṃ iti vacīsucaritassa vipāko, iti manosucaritaṃ iti manosucaritassa vipāko, iti devā, iti manussāti.
segments.en: ‘This is good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind. This is the result of good conduct by way of body, speech, and mind. This is life as a god. This is life as a human.’
The harsh way is this:

segments.pli: iti kāyaduccaritaṃ iti kāyaduccaritassa vipāko, iti vacīduccaritaṃ iti vacīduccaritassa vipāko, iti manoduccaritaṃ iti manoduccaritassa vipāko, iti nirayo, iti tiracchānayoni, iti pettivisayoti.
segments.en: ‘This is bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind. This is the result of bad conduct by way of body, speech, and mind. This is life in hell. This is life as an animal. This is life as a ghost.’
The both gentle and harsh way is this:

segments.pli: iti kāyasucaritaṃ iti kāyasucaritassa vipāko, iti kāyaduccaritaṃ iti kāyaduccaritassa vipāko, iti vacīsucaritaṃ iti vacīsucaritassa vipāko, iti vacīduccaritaṃ iti vacīduccaritassa vipāko, iti manosucaritaṃ iti manosucaritassa vipāko, iti manoduccaritaṃ iti manoduccaritassa vipāko, iti devā, iti manussā, iti nirayo, iti tiracchānayoni, iti pettivisayo”ti.
segments.en: ‘This is good conduct … this is bad conduct …’”

segments.pli: “Sace te, bhante, purisadammo saṇhena vinayaṃ na upeti, pharusena vinayaṃ na upeti, saṇhapharusena vinayaṃ na upeti, kinti naṃ bhagavā karotī”ti?
segments.en: “Sir, what do you do with a person in training who doesn’t follow these forms of training?”

segments.pli: “Sace me, kesi, purisadammo saṇhena vinayaṃ na upeti, pharusena vinayaṃ na upeti, saṇhapharusena vinayaṃ na upeti, hanāmi naṃ, kesī”ti.
segments.en: “In that case, Kesi, I kill them.”
“Sir, it’s not appropriate for the Buddha to kill living creatures.
And yet you say
you kill them.”
“It’s true, Kesi,
it’s not appropriate for a Realized One to kill living creatures.

segments.pli: Api ca yo purisadammo saṇhena vinayaṃ na upeti, pharusena vinayaṃ na upeti, saṇhapharusena vinayaṃ na upeti, na taṃ tathāgato vattabbaṃ anusāsitabbaṃ maññati, nāpi viññū sabrahmacārī vattabbaṃ anusāsitabbaṃ maññanti.
segments.en: But when a person in training doesn’t follow any of these forms of training, the Realized One doesn’t think they’re worth advising or instructing, and neither do their sensible spiritual companions.
For it is death in the training of the noble one

segments.pli: yaṃ na tathāgato vattabbaṃ anusāsitabbaṃ maññati, nāpi viññū sabrahmacārī vattabbaṃ anusāsitabbaṃ maññantī”ti.
segments.en: when the Realized One doesn’t think they’re worth advising or instructing, and neither do their sensible spiritual companions.”
“Well, they’re definitely dead

segments.pli: yaṃ na tathāgato vattabbaṃ anusāsitabbaṃ maññati, nāpi viññū sabrahmacārī vattabbaṃ anusāsitabbaṃ maññantīti.
segments.en: when the Realized One doesn’t think they’re worth advising or instructing, and neither do their sensible spiritual companions.

segments.pli: Abhikkantaṃ, bhante, abhikkantaṃ, bhante … pe … upāsakaṃ maṃ, bhante, bhagavā dhāretu ajjatagge pāṇupetaṃ saraṇaṃ gatan”ti.
segments.en: Excellent, sir! … From this day forth, may the Buddha remember me as a lay follower who has gone for refuge for life.”
